Upokojenci brezplačno iz kraja v kraj
02 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Katja Gleščič

Upokojenci oziroma starejši od 65 let, gibalno ovirani študenti in invalidi, registrirani športniki in dijaki ter vojni veterani bodo od 1. julija leta 2020 imeli brezplačen medkrajevni javni potniški promet.



Foto: Ministrstvo za infrastrukturo

SLOVENIJA > “Edina večja skupina, ki doslej ni imela večjih ugodnosti v javnem prevozu, so starejši od 65 let, ki niso več v delovnem razmerju, upokojenci, ki niso v delovnem razmerju, in invalidi, ki niso v delovnem razmerju. Brezplačne vozovnice za to skupino pomenijo vabilo, naj neomejeno in varno potujejo z javnim potniškim prometom. Tako bomo zagotovili njihovo mobilnost, povečali možnosti samostojnega življenja in ohranjanja socialnih stikov in potovanj,” je predstavila ministrica za infrastrukturo Alenka Bratušek. V DZ so novelo zakona o javnih prevozih v cestnem prometu s to spremembo podprli soglasno.
Ministrstvo bo vodilo podatke o potnikih
Za upokojence bo novost začela veljati 1. julija prihodnje leto, a jih že zdaj zanima, kako bo to konkretno potekalo v praksi, kako bodo uveljavljali brezplačni prevoz. Pri avtobusnem prevozniku Arriva Slovenija so včeraj povedali, da o tem uradno še niso bili obveščeni. “Rok za uvedbo je 1. julij prihodnje leto, kar vsem omogoča zadosti časa za ureditev tega področja,” pravijo v Nomagu. “V zadnjem obdobju smo v Sloveniji že sprejeli nekatere ukrepe, kot sta enotna vozovnice za vse potnike, in hitre linije, ki so večja slovenska mesta povezala s prestolnico. Skupaj z zadnjo odločitvijo bodo ukrepi verjetno že srednjeročno pozitivno vplivali na zmanjšanje zastojev, popularizacijo javnega potniškega prometa in večjo mobilnost upokojencev,” ocenjuje glavni izvršni direktor Nomaga Sandi Brataševec.
Na ministrstvu so razložili, da sprejeti zakon ureja tudi pravno podlago za to, da bo ministrstvo vodilo osebne podatke potnikov za različne vrste vozovnic. “To je nujen ukrep za uvedbo ugodnosti, kot so brezplačni prevozi za upokojence in športnike,” pojasnjujejo.
Ukrep ne prinaša večjih dodatnih stroškov, saj medkrajevne povezave že danes sofinancira država, tudi če so vlaki in avtobusi na pol prazni ali čisto prazni, zatrjujejo na ministrstvu. Sicer pa se pripravljajo na nov razpis za podelitev koncesij avtobusnim prevoznikom, ki se jim koncesije iztečejo 2. decembra letos.
Športniki na vadbe in tekmovanja
Novelo pozdravljajo v Olimpijskem komiteju Slovenije (OKS) - Združenju športnih zvez: “Marsikateremu mlademu športniku lahko prevoz na kraj vadbe pomeni finančno in časovno obremenitev in tako obremenjuje nemoten razvoj športnika.” Novost bo veljala za celotno Slovenijo, tako da bo vključevala tudi prevoz na tekmovanja.

Seniors free from place to place
02 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Katja Glescic

Seniors and seniors 65, physically impaired students and disabled people, registered athletes and students, and war veterans will have free long distance public transit service from 1 July 2020.



Photo: Ministry of Infrastructure

SLOVENIA> “The only major group that has not had significant benefits in public transport so far are those over 65 who are no longer in employment, retired persons who are not in employment, and disabled persons who are not in employment. Free tickets for this group are an invitation to travel public transit unrestrictedly and safely. In this way, we will ensure their mobility, increase the chances of living independently and maintaining social contacts and travel, ”said Minister of Infrastructure Alenka Bratusek. In the National Assembly, the amendment to the Law on Public Transport in Road Transport was supported unanimously by this amendment.
The ministry will keep track of passenger information
For the seniors, the novelty will come into force on July 1 next year, but they are already interested in how this will be put into practice in practice, how they will apply free transport. Arriva Slovenia's bus carrier said yesterday that they had not been officially informed. "The deadline for implementation is July 1 next year, which gives everyone plenty of time to sort this out," they say in Nomag. “In the recent period, Slovenia has already taken some measures, such as uniform tickets for all passengers, and express lines connecting major Slovenian cities with the capital. Together with the last decision, the measures are likely to have a positive effect in the medium term on reducing congestion, popularizing public passenger transport and increasing the mobility of pensioners, ”Nomaga chief executive Sandi Bratasevec said.
The ministry explained that the adopted law also regulates the legal basis for the ministry to keep personal data of passengers for different types of tickets. "This is a necessary measure to introduce benefits such as free transfers for seniors and athletes," they explain.
The measure does not entail significant additional costs, since long-distance connections are already co-financed by the state, even if the trains and buses are half empty or completely empty, according to the ministry. Otherwise, they are preparing for a new tender for the award of concessions to bus operators, whose concessions expire on December 2 this year.
Athletes to workouts and competitions
The novel is welcomed by the Olympic Committee of Slovenia (OKS) - Association of Sports Federations: “Many young athletes may be financially and temporarily burdened with exercise and thus impede the smooth development of the athlete.” competitions.
